Package game.search

Class Evaluation

java.lang.Object
game.search.Evaluation
public class Evaluation extends Object
Class to compute the current evaluation of a chess position.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ryu

  • Method Details

    • mopUpEval

      public int mopUpEval(boolean isWhite, int myMaterial, int opponentMaterial, float endgameWeight)
      End Game incentive to make it easier to checkmate.
      Parameters:
      isWhite - Indicates whether the side being evaluated is white.
      myMaterial - Material score for the side being evaluated.
      opponentMaterial - Material score for the opponent side.
      endgameWeight - Weight factor for the endgame.
      Returns:
      The mop-up score for the given conditions.

    • evaluate

      public int evaluate(boolean isWhite)
      Performs static evaluation of the current position. The position is assumed to be 'quiet', i.e no captures are available that could drastically affect the evaluation. The score that's returned is given from the perspective of whoever's turn it is to move. So a positive score means the player who's turn it is to move has an advantage, while a negative score indicates a disadvantage.
      Parameters:
      isWhite - Indicates whether the side being evaluated is white.
      Returns:
      The evaluation score for the current position from the perspective of the side being evaluated.
